Our team‚Äôs diverse background and extensive experience mean that every aspect of your event is in expert hands. We collaborate closely with you to bring your dreams to life, ensuring a seamless and stress-free experience. From planning to execution, we are committed to excellence, making your special day truly unforgettable. Our Team Our team brings over a century of combined experience to ensure your wedding or event is nothing short of incredible. Meet the talented individuals whose expertise and dedication will make your special day unforgettable. Carissa Llewellyn-Burns Director of Operations Carissa joined the company in 2013. A communications and journalism graduate of Shippensburg University, she moved from Pennsylvania to Florida for sunshine and job opportunities. She began her career with Dubsdread as a banquet server and has worked her way through every position in the office to learn each aspect of the operation and is proud to be part of the amazing team. When she is not at work, Carissa enjoys time with her husband, Tyler, her crazy kiddos Connor and Cameron and her fur child, Roxy. Christiana Bullard Banquet Sales Manager An Orlando native and a UCF graduate, Christiana worked in advertising before joining Dubsdread in 2005. She found the hospitality industry far more entertaining and mentally stimulating. Christiana enjoys humorous clients, problem-solving, and working with great colleagues. When she is not at work, she enjoys watching UCF football, going to the gym and spending time with her three ‚Äúkids:‚Äù her daughter, husband and dog. David Osmola Senior Wedding & Event Coordinator David joined the Dubsdread team in 2008 and is our Senior Wedding and Event Coordinator. Before coming on board, he worked in customer service positions in the wedding and airline industries. David strives to make every bride‚Äôs dream a reality, allowing his attention to detail and customer service skills to shine through. When he is not at work, David enjoys spending time with his friends and his dog, Sweet Pea, and visiting family in Michigan. Michelle Edmiston Event Specialist/Sales Representative Michelle joined the team in 2017 and wears many hats, managing the property at The Highland Manor being one of them.  She grew up working in a family friend‚Äôs restaurant and expanded that knowledge working at country clubs, event venues, hotels and stadiums. After nearly three decades, she still loves helping her client's vision become a reality. When Michelle is not planning an event, she spends time with her husband Jay, son Blake, two rescue dogs and her vast extended family. Shanna Paris Event Specialist/Sales Representative Shanna has been at Dubsdread since 2017. An Event Management graduate of the University of Central Florida‚Äôs Rosen College of Hospitality, she began her career with local wedding and destination event management companies. Since 2000, Shanna has planned weddings and events throughout the Orlando area, helping planners worldwide execute their corporate gatherings. At Dubsdread, she can focus on her passion to help brides make their day unique and personal. Shanna enjoys time with her four favorite guys when she‚Äôs not at work: her dog Giggsy, her sons Liam and Alfie and her husband Josh. Peighton Ballant Event Specialist/Sales Representative Peighton is a native of Orlando and joined Dubsdread in 2018. In 2021, she earned her Event Management degree at the University of Central Florida‚Äôs Rosen College of Hospitality. Before joining the events team, Peighton was a hostess at The Tap Room at Dubsdread. Peighton enjoys working with prospective brides to discover what they are most interested in bringing to their special day and how to make those ideas come to life. When not at work, she enjoys caring for Dexter, her cat-child, going to the beach, hanging out with friends, and being a UCF Knight football fan. Roxy Llewellyn-Burns EBanquet Operations Ambassador Roxy joined the team in January 2015. A Pet Smart‚Äôs Elite Obedience School graduate, she parlayed her training into a unique and valued office position. Roxy‚Äôs favorite role is greeting guests and fulfilling her Events by Dubsdread ambassador duties. When not at work, Roxy enjoys playing fetch with her humans, licking her brothers, belly rubs, treats, being completely spoiled and days at the doggie spa. Kristen Berry Wedding & Event Coordinator Kristen joined the Dubsdread team as a catering captain in 2021 before transitioning to a wedding and event coordinator. She graduated with a degree in the arts and found she preferred the people-oriented nature, pacing, and problem-solving that comes with working in the service industry. Kristen enjoys planning, facilitating, and contributing to creating joyous occasions. When she is not at work, she loves traveling, cooking, working on creative projects and hanging out with her two cats, Diana and Henry. Real Wedding at The Highland Manor ‚Äì Taylor and Brian - Events by Dubsdread Skip to content Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Real Wedding at The Highland Manor ‚Äì Taylor and Brian Real Wedding at The Highland Manor ‚Äì Taylor Welsh and Brian King At Dubsdread Catering we love being dedicated members of the team that makes your big day your best day. While we are masters at the planning and executing the behind-the-scenes work, we know our clients have their own unique perspective on their event. We thank recent couple Taylor Welsh and Brian King for graciously sharing their experience to benefit others. BRIDE AND GROOM: Taylor Welsh and Brian King WEDDING DATE: December 10, 2022 VENUE: The Highland Manor EVENT COORDINATOR: Michelle Edmiston, Event Specialist/Sales Representative VENDORS: Photographer: Photography by Greg See our Dubsdread Catering Vendor Profile on Photography by Greg Florist: Fairbanks Florist https://www.fairbanksflorist.net/ See our Dubsdread Catering Vendor Profile on Fairbanks Florist DJ: Junction 88 See our Dubsdread Catering Vendor Profile on DJ Mike and Junction 88 Hair/Makeup: Grace Ha & Presila Pilar Draping: W Draping Dessert: Tru Cakes ONE YEAR OUT: How/where did you get engaged? Brian proposed to me in July of 2019 in front of Cinderella‚Äôs castle at Walt Disney World‚Äôs Magic Kingdom. Before the pandemic we were annual passholders and made the two-hour drive once or twice a month to visit the parks. I had a feeling that the proposal was coming so it was nerve wracking to act 100% surprised but I still loved every minute of it. It was also my birthday weekend, so we finished off the evening with dinner inside the castle, taking photos with all of the princesses as they came around to our table. What are you most excited about for your wedding day? Brian is super excited about the food, and I have to say I am too ‚Äì we are huge foodie people! But in all seriousness, we are mostly excited to come together with family and friends and finally just celebrate our marriage. Postponing and rescheduling our wedding three separate times was taking a toll on everyone involved but we wanted to make sure we could be inclusive of all our loved ones. I am dreaming of what he is going to look like in his suit, and I know his curiosity about my dress has been killing him ‚Äì in a good way! What aspect are you excited to plan the most? (Ceremony, food & beverages, photographer, DJ) Did I mention we love food ‚Äì oh, and the cake, of course! I could also talk about the decor and flowers all day long if given the chance. It‚Äôs difficult to choose just one aspect that we are excited about because I just know the entire day will be wonderful no matter what happens or what we choose. We just can‚Äôt wait to get married! A FEW MONTHS OUT / PLANNING PROCESS: How do you feel the planning is going? We have thankfully had a lot of time to prepare for our ceremony and that has given us breathing room. With less than four months to go we have a lot of small items left open that Michelle Edmiston , our wonderful Dubsdread Catering coordinator , has kept us on track with ideas, updates, and reminders that that I never would have thought of on my own! I created a checklist based on our conversations to help us stay on track. Being able to visualize what‚Äôs outstanding has been a huge help. What have you found to be more difficult than you expected? Ensuring that everyone received a save the date and formal invitation in the mail has been a lot harder than I expected! Brian has lived at the same address (until we got engaged) for nearly two decades, and I also had been in the same location for nearly ten. That just isn‚Äôt the norm anymore and I learned the hard way once mail either did not arrive at a guest‚Äôs address or I had it being returned to me. Never assume just because a few months ago someone lived in one place that they haven‚Äôt moved! I think that if we were to do this over again, I would save paper invites for family and look more into digital options for other guests. What has been more fun about the process than you expected? With our families being on the small side these days, it‚Äôs been so nice to see everyone just generally be excited for the big day. Normally the bride‚Äôs dress shopping is a huge deal ‚Äì and it was a lovely day ‚Äì but personally seeing my future mother-in-law pick out a gorgeous gown of her own made my heart so full. Brian‚Äôs father had a suit custom made and my mother is also having her gown created by a family friend. Weddings and formal events are something none of us typically find ourselves a part of and so we wanted everyone to feel special and confident in what they were wearing. We can‚Äôt wait to see the photographs in the end when it all comes together. WEDDING DAY: What was the best, most memorable part of your big day? Since the sun sets rather quickly in December, we had to do a first look and take the bulk of our photographs before the ceremony. I was caught up in the whirlwind of the bridal party being awake since the sun rose that morning, afraid that we would run out of time. When I came downstairs to meet Brian and our families I had to pause and take everything in. His reaction to seeing me in my dress was emotional and so special. At that moment the photographs didn‚Äôt matter, I didn‚Äôt hear the buzz of guests arriving down the hall, I just felt like only he and I seemed to exist in that moment. We could have gotten married right there in the entryway of the manor and it would have been perfect. If you could change one or two things about your event, what would they be? I should have asked someone to record the cocktail hour musicians that we hired, even if it was on a cell phone. Our photographer was wonderful at keeping a tight timeline while making sure we had lots of lovely pictures but it‚Äôs simply just impossible to be in so many places at once when you are the bride and groom. I did manage to watch and listen from a distance while my dress was being bustled in a corner and snuck in a couple of tunes! I also should have researched how to preserve a wedding bouquet a lot sooner than a month after the event. My bouquet has been drying on a towel on our dining room table since we arrived home and I am still unsure of what to do with it! Is there any advice you would give other couples planning their event that you wish some-one had told you? When planning a wedding ‚Äì no matter how big or how small ‚Äì there will always be someone that is not accepting or approving of the choices you are making about your day. You will not please everyone no matter how hard you try. Your wedding is about you and your future spouse and what makes the two of you happy. The only thing you can control about your wedding day is how you react to what is happening around you. Focus on your own needs and those of your partner. This can also apply to unexpected hiccups that may happen throughout the process or even the day of. We definitely had to go with the flow as we had multiple members of the wedding party suddenly drop out for various reasons with about a week to go. They were missed dearly, but in the end, we had each other and that‚Äôs what truly matters. Photos courtesy of the bride, groom, and Photography by Greg. When you book a wedding with Dubsdread Catering at one of our exclusive venues, we provide wedding coordination at no additional charge. Our coordinators become dedicated members of your team bringing experience and expertise to help you execute your vision. Contact them today via our Contact Us page to make our team your team in making your dreams come true. Venue Spotlight ‚Äì The Highland Manor - Events by Dubsdread Skip to content Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Venue Spotlight ‚Äì The Highland Manor Venue Spotlight ‚Äì The Highland Manor Nestled on secluded grounds in Apopka, The Highland Manor is surrounded by ancient oaks and steeped in 110 years of history. Once a grand private home, the Apopka landmark has become one of Central Florida‚Äôs premier event venues exclusively available through Dubsdread Catering. Come visit us and find yourself on our sweeping veranda looking out over ancient oaks, rolling scenic vistas, and gracious spaces all providing a classic and stunning backdrop for your special Central Florida wedding or event. A great location with plenty of options for events of all sizes and has three different spaces within the facility to select from, or combine, to accommodate groups large and small. Hosting Your Wedding or Event at The Highland Manor The Highland Manor features distinguished details you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. The large, rambling house with its metal roof and native woodwork is charming and authentic. The Crystal Ballroom and Oak Room are perfect for ceremonies or receptions and the Verandah with its many glass windows is the perfect stage for buffets. The large bar area is grand and provides plenty of room for intimate cocktail functions. The rolling oak-shaded lawn offers stunning natural backdrops for wedding photos and videos. Many wedding ceremonies take place under one of the grand oak trees for those looking for a gorgeous natural setting. We are able to accommodate parties of 20 to 250 for a full dinner service and cocktail-style receptions for up to 600 guests, when utilizing all banquet areas. The Highland Manor has been voted the best wedding venue in Central Florida by readers of The Knot nine years in a row. . The Highland Manor is also the perfect location for business meetings, corporate functions, conventions and conferences as well as space for baby or bridal showers, milestone birthday celebrations and so much more.The versatile venue offers a combination of indoor and outdoor event spaces that allows for the flexibility in size, seating and ability to move your group from outdoor for a cocktail reception or tented soir√©e, to a full sit-down dinner. Our atmosphere is truly unmatched in Central Florida, providing the perfect venue and setting for unforgettable receptions and parties. Included at no additional charge When you plan your wedding with Dubsdread Catering, our event coordinators become dedicated members of your team for no additional charge. They offer knowledge, experience, and professional polish, to your event and attend to the details. Venue-owned tables, chairs, ceremony chairs, house linens are included with the venue rental. Tour the space at its most magical and see why couples fall in love with our venues ‚Äî but choose us for our service.¬†If you‚Äôre considering one of Events by Dubsdread exclusive venues or our catering services at one of our partner locations, this is the perfect chance to meet our team, experience our service, enjoy food and beverage samples, check out vendors, and imagine what‚Äôs possible. Location: The Highland Manor ‚Ä¢ 604 E Main St, Apopka, FL 32703 Date/Time: Sunday, September 14th, 2025 ‚Ä¢ 11 a.m. ‚Äì 1 p.m. RSVP Today Share this event with your friends ‚ÄúBest Laid Plans‚Äù Murder Mystery Dinner at The Highland Manor The Highland Manor Friday, September 26 ¬∑ 5:30 p.m. ‚Äì 9:30 p.m. Due to popular demand, the murder mystery returns! Join us on Friday, September 26 at The Highland Manor for ‚ÄúBest Laid Plans‚Äù , a glamorous Old Hollywood murder mystery dinner you won‚Äôt forget. About ‚Äî MANOR TAVERN Menus About Catering and Events Reservations Gift Cards Contact Back Lunch Dinner Dessert Brunch Bar Menu Wine Bottle List Wine by the Glass Specialty Cocktails WEEKLY SPECIALS Back Manor Events & Wine Suppers Catering at Manor Tavern Catering Off Premise Menus Lunch Dinner Dessert Brunch Bar Menu Wine Bottle List Wine by the Glass Specialty Cocktails WEEKLY SPECIALS About Catering and Events Manor Events & Wine Suppers Catering at Manor Tavern Catering Off Premise Reservations Gift Cards Contact THE HISTORY Come Out to the Country, We‚Äôre Worth the Drive The Manor Tavern is a picturesque, 267 year old property dating back to the time of George Washington and is said to have housed the first president‚Äôs horse on occasion. In fact, the area began as a stable and over the years had evolved into a blacksmith shop, a general store and a saloon. Our logo, inclusive of a horse, is a hat tip to our historic roots here in Monkton. Today, it‚Äôs a country oasis in the heart of steeplechase land where friends and family gather for delectable food and exquisite service. Like our history here in Maryland, our patrons are loyal and longstanding. We value the relationships we have cultivated with all of you year after year. FARM-TO-TABLE At the Manor Tavern, taste is everything. Our grounds allow us to control all aspects of the growing process from our farm to your table. We are always open to suggestions so share with us any specific herbs or produce you‚Äôd like to see in our garden. Optimal Freshness Our produce is generally harvested when we need it. When a fruit or vegetable is given the time to completely ripen, it fully develops and retains its vitamins and minerals, giving it a more vibrant flavor and maximizing the nutritional content. Our large variety of items have a longer time to ripen ‚Äúon the vine‚Äù ultimately eliminating travel time and processing and optimizing the taste and texture of our food. Community Each item that we grow has its own unique story. Growing and buying locally means you are supporting the family farmers and ranchers that raised your food. Connecting to the sources is a very meaningful part of the overall experience. Our selection of available produce changes weekly, dependent upon what is readily available in our area. This allows us to deliver items when they are at their peak, are most abundant, and in the case of farmers markets, least expensive. Managing Partner, The Manor Group Jerry Edwards, CPCE Founder of Chef‚Äôs Expressions at the Manor, NACE Hall of Fame Inductee, Hospitality Industry Icon Award Winner From 1981 to 2020, Jerry was Founder and Owner of Chef‚Äôs Expressions Catering and Events, which has twice been named The National Catering Company of the Year. Jerry holds an honorary doctorate in hospitality.¬†In 2008, he was inducted into the NACE Hall of Fame. In 2015, Jerry was honored as a National Industry Icon by the hospitality community. He has won over 50 industry competitions including Baltimore‚Äôs Best Crab Soup, three ACF Gold Medals, the ‚ÄúBest Chef‚Äù for the Meals on Wheels Culinary Extravaganza, The Crystal Toque Award in the Nation‚Äôs Capitol, The Special Event Award for best event, Baltimore‚Äôs ‚ÄúIron Chef‚Äù competition and the Mid-Atlantic Taste of Elegance competition. Today, Jerry leads the team of professionals at The Manor Tavern.¬† These outstanding individuals include Alicia Strawderman, Director of Chef‚Äôs Expressions at The Manor, Luis Banegas, Manor Tavern Restaurant Manager, Zoltan Dober-Huang and Executive Chef Sebastien Lemarre. Our team is here to serve you and create an unparalleled experience. Restaurant Manager, The Manor Tavern Luis Banegas Luis began his career with Chef‚Äôs Expressions in 1997. His infectious smile and dedication to serving guests quickly propelled him to become the top catering manager. He later managed the Chef‚Äôs Expressions operations team for over 10 years, honing his skills in leadership and customer service. With extensive experience in fine dining and exceptional hospitality, Luis is now the perfect choice to manage The Manor Tavern. This storied restaurant has undergone a renaissance under a new management team, bringing fresh enthusiasm and innovative ideas to the Tavern. Be sure to stop in and see Luis or Assistant Manager/ Sommelier Zoltan Dober -Huang, soon. Their warm welcome and exceptional service are sure to enhance your dining experience. Executive Chef, The Manor Tavern Restaurant Sebastien Lemarre Chef Sebastien brings a wealth of culinary expertise and leadership to The Manor Tavern, elevating its dining and catering experiences. With a distinguished career as both a Chef and Culinary Instructor, Sebastien has seamlessly integrated into The Manor Tavern team, sharing his knowledge in culinary arts and management. Under his leadership, he has built a talented team of chefs and cooks dedicated to delivering some of the finest restaurant and catering cuisine in the region. His impressive r√©sum√© includes serving as Executive Chef at Hunt Valley Country Club and contributing to World Central Kitchen as Director of Relief Training and Director of Culinary Training. His passion for culinary education has also been a significant asset to The Manor Tavern. He previously held roles as Culinary Arts Instructor and Coordinator in Mayag√ºez, as well as Culinary Arts Academy Director at Escuela Hotelera de San Juan. Sebastien‚Äôs dedication to culinary excellence and mentorship continues to shape and strengthen The Manor Tavern‚Äôs culinary offerings. Assistant Manager, The Manor Tavern Zoltan Dober - Huang Zolt√°n was born in Budapest, Hungary, and raised in San Jose, California. A recent Maryland transplant, he‚Äôs eager to explore everything the Chesapeake Bay State has to offer. With extensive experience in every Front of House role, Zolt√°n brings a deep understanding of hospitality to his managerial responsibilities. Having lived in California‚Äôs renowned wine regions, he developed a passion for winemaking and tasting, which he now shares as the leader of The Manor Tavern‚Äôs wine education program. He also curates weekly wine initiatives, including complimentary tastings and wine-by-the-glass specials, to enhance the guest experience. Zolt√°n‚Äôs ultimate dream is to own a chic cocktail and wine club featuring live jazz every night. In the meantime, he‚Äôs dedicated to bringing that same energy and creativity to The Manor Tavern. 410.771.8155 info@manortavern.com Hours VISIT US HOURS 15819 Old York Rd. Real Wedding The Highland Manor - Alexis Johnston & Benjamin Silva - Events by Dubsdread Skip to content Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Real Wedding The Highland Manor ‚Äì Alexis Johnston & Benjamin Silva Alexis Johnston & Benjamin Silva ‚Äì 10/7/23 ‚Äì The Highland Manor Photographer/Videographer: Honeywood Photography DJ: Soundwave Entertainment Florist: Dream Design Cake/Dessert: Cake n Bake Hair/Makeup: Kristy‚Äôs Artistry Design Team Photobooth: Soundwave Entertainment Draping: W Draping Pre-Wedding Experiences How/where did you get engaged? We were having a pool party at our house to celebrate Ben‚Äôs birthday and our college graduation. Towards the end, right before the cake, Ben started to give a speech to say thanks to everyone. His uncle actually interrupted the speech to sing a happy graduation song to him, but Ben asked him to stop so he could finish. The rest of the speech turned into a proposal. I was super surprised when it happened, but of course I said yes! What are you most excited about for your wedding day? Ben is most excited about spending time and sharing our exciting day with family. Honestly, I‚Äôm excited about everything that has to do with our wedding day. I can‚Äôt pick one thing to be most excited about. What aspect are you excited to plan the most? (ceremony, food & beverages, photographer, DJ) Ben is most excited to plan the reception, and I‚Äôm most excited to plan the ceremony. Wedding Planning How do you feel the planning is going? Planning is going pretty well! We have gotten a lot done so far, but we still have a ways to go before we are completely ready for the big day. What have you found to be more difficult than you expected? Timing has been more difficult¬†than I expected. There was¬†such a large gap between when we got engaged to our wedding day that¬†I put off a lot of the planning and booking of vendors. I definitely wished I had spaced out everything a little better. What has been more fun about the process than you expected? The most fun thing about the whole process is getting to try out all these once in a lifetime experiences Wedding Day What was the best, most memorable part of your big day? I think the best, most memorable part was the ceremony. For me, walking down that aisle to the love of my life and expressing our love was my favorite part. For Ben, his most memorable part was seeing me come out the door and walk down the aisle. If you could change one or two things about your event, what would they be? We wish we had more time for all the things we wanted. I also wish I had taken the opportunity to eat some of the food we ordered (like appetizers and late night snacks) when they weren‚Äôt brought to me. Is there any advice you would give other couples planning their event that you wish someone had told you? My advice would be to make sure to be present and live every moment of your event. I felt like my whole wedding went by so fast, and while I got to do everything I wanted and more, I wish I had more time. Real Wedding ‚Äì The Highland Manor ‚Äì Grossholz and Sharp - Events by Dubsdread Skip to content Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Weddings Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Events Azalea Lodge at Mead Botanical Garden Home The Highland Manor Home Historic Dubsdread Home Catering Contact Us More Pricing Guide About Application for Employment Gallery Blog Real Wedding ‚Äì The Highland Manor ‚Äì Grossholz and Sharp Real Wedding at The Highland Manor ‚Äì Nicole Grossholz and Coltee Sharp At Dubsdread Catering we love being dedicated members of the team that makes your big day your best day. While we are masters at the planning and executing the behind-the-scenes work, we know our clients have their own unique perspective on their event. We thank recent couple Nicole Grossholz and Coltee Sharp for graciously sharing their experience to benefit others. BRIDE AND GROOM: Nicole Grossholz and Coltee Sharp WEDDING DATE: April 16, 2022 VENUE: The Highland Manor EVENT COORDINATOR: David Osmola, Senior Wedding and Event Coordinator VENDORS: PHOTOGRAPHER : PB&J Studios FLORIST: Dream Designs Florist DJ: DJ Yves Entertainment DESSERT: Bakers Cottage OTHER: W Draping ONE YEAR OUT: How/where did you get engaged? He proposed at Disney Springs. We were supposed to be taking family Christmas photos, but he surprised me with the proposal. It was perfect because both of our families were there! What are you most excited about for your wedding day? We‚Äôre excited to celebrate and dance with all our closest friends and family! What aspect are you excited to plan the most? (Ceremony, food & beverages, photographer, DJ) We‚Äôre so excited to plan all the reception details including the decor, flowers, and how the food will be set up. The food is important to us because good food makes any occasion better! A FEW MONTHS OUT / PLANNING PROCESS: How do you feel the planning is going? We feel good with where we are at because we really have most everything done. All that is left are just small decorations to decide on. What have you found to be more difficult than you expected? Keeping to our budget has been more difficult than I expected. What has been more fun about the process than you expected? My favorite part so far was finding my dress. WEDDING DAY: What was the best, most memorable part of your big day? For us it was our ceremony. It was the happiest moment of our lives to finally say, ‚ÄúI do.‚Äù If you could change one or two things about your event, what would they be? Sadly, our cake wasn‚Äôt what we were expecting. I am gluten intolerant and the cake we test tasted isn‚Äôt what our cake ended up tasting like and we were very disappointed. Otherwise, everything else was perfect and I wouldn‚Äôt change anything else. Is there any advice you would give other couples planning their event that you wish some-one had told you? Have a plan and stay ahead of your schedule. Surround yourself with people who support you and what you want. Lastly and most importantly is don‚Äôt be afraid to put your foot down for what you are want. A lot of times you may feel pressured to give up things due to others‚Äô opinions or difficulties, but where there‚Äôs a will there‚Äôs a way. Our coordinators become dedicated members of your team bringing experience and expertise to help you execute your vision. Contact them today via our Contact Us page to make our team your team in making your dreams come true. - A Sleepingly Beautiful Pantomime Sneak Peek: CHRISTMAS AT SACRED HEART DOWNTOWN 2025 Sneak Peek: A CHRISTMAS CAROL 2025 Digital Experience Folder: GET INVOLVED Back 2025 FALL AUDITIONS Radical Access Work With Us Volunteer Become A Sponsor House An Artist Rent Our Space Join Our Mail List Folder: LEARN MORE Back HAT Gazette Blog July 2025 About Us Contact Us FAQ Past Productions Community Partners Seating Chart HAT ACADEMY Folder: DONATE Back Donate To Radical Access All Donations TICKETS WELCOME TO THE HIGHLAND ARTS THEATRE HERE YOU‚Äôll find information about our team, organization, history, achievements, and our vision for our community PURPOSE To inspire artists, audiences and youth by creating meaningful opportunities that educate, entertain, and encourage. VISION The HAT will be a leader of artistic excellence for the performing arts in Atlantic Canada, enriching the lives of artists, audiences, and the broader¬†community through accessible professional theatre. MISSION To fortify the professional theatre community¬†in Cape Breton, to¬†drive the local creative economy,¬†to produce first-class, home-grown productions, and champion the education of the next generation of theatre artists. MANDATE To provide a year-round, professional theatrical presence in downtown Sydney, producing and presenting quality productions with a special emphasis on Cape Breton artists, stories, and songs. About Us Highland Arts Theatre, or "The HAT" as it's affectionately called, is the name of a performance venue in downtown Sydney, Nova Scotia, formerly the home of St. Andrew's Church. When the church was decommissioned in 2013, a team led by local businessman Kevin Colford stepped up to transform the beloved historical building into a state-of-the-art centre for arts and culture. The venue officially re-opened in June 2014 with an original musical comedy:¬†"The Wakowski Brothers". While the venue is available for rent and has hosted many of Cape Breton's finest in the fields of music, comedy, dance and literature (such as Brent Butt, Ron James, The CBC Massey Lecture, Port Cities) , it is our mandate to create a year-round, professional theatrical presence in downtown Sydney, producing and presenting quality productions with a special emphasis on Cape Breton artists, stories, and songs. The Highland Arts Theatre Association is a non-profit organization registered under the Societies Act of Nova Scotia (3285136) and a registered charity with the Canada Revenue Agency (82383 3181 RR0001.) We are a Professional Member of Theatre Nova Scotia and have memberships with the Sydney & Area Chamber of Commerce, the Playwrights Atlantic Resource Centre (PARC), and the Playwrights Guild of Canada. In 2020, we piloted our brand new operating model: Radical Access - a crowd-sourcing model that allows us to offer all Mainstage Productions free of charge (inquire today for bookings or donations at info@highlandartstheatre.com). Our productions have toured to Ontario, Prince Edward Island, and mainland Nova Scotia and we have conducted partnerships and co-productions with Neptune Theatre, the Savoy Theatre, Sacred Heart Downtown, Eastern Front Theatre, Theatre New Brunswick, Festival Antigonish, The Confederation Centre for the Arts, the 2023 Canada Games, and the Chester Playhouse. About the Building Built by the Sydney and Mira Presbyterian congregation, originating in 1852, construction for St. Andrew's United Church started in 1910 and was completed in 1911. It was the third church built by the congregation, and was built to contain 1,000 people for services. Designed by architects Curry and Sparling, and built by Rhodes and Curry Company, the building was constructed using red brick from Mira, and the cost was $62,945. The church was fit with a 3,000 pipe pipe-organ made by the famous Casavant Fr√®res in Quebec, as well as 10 engraved bell chimes that are¬†still in use today. Architecturally, the end result was a beautiful house of worship, with impressive towers, bells chiming on Sundays and the steadfast permanence of the Gothic Revival style, rare within the Cape Breton Regional Municipality. In 2014, local business man Kevin Colford renovated the former church into its current form, a state of the art theatre venue in Downtown Sydney. HAT Academy After several years of courses being offered through the Highland Arts Theatre, the HAT Academy was officially launched in 2019 to meet the growing demand for more education opportunities. Courses and training programs are offered for recreational, emerging, and professional artists aged 5 to 105, covering topics including acting, music, dance, triple threat performance, writing, directing, stage craft, improv, Shakespeare, and more! Our first Academy production, Seussical the Musical, hit the stage in March 2019. The Academy's current home is 295 Charlotte Street, just behind the main theatre building. Many students (youth and adult) have made the leap from the Academy to the Mainstage, being hired as performers and stage craft artists in our season of professional productions. Some have had their writing developed for full length productions, and members of our current faculty began as students of the Academy. Whether you're looking for artistic growth or something to do, we pride the HAT Academy as a jumping off point for those looking to get more involved in our community. Thanks to our Radical Access program 100 scholarships are awarded annually to students in need of financial support. For more information, you can email us at academy@highlandartstheatre.com ! Circa 1928, scanned from the St. Andrew's Church Annual Report MEET THE TEAM Wesley j. colford ARTISTIC & EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (they/them) Wesley J. Colford is a Dora and Merritt Nominated playwright and theatre artist from Cape Breton who currently resides in Sydney, NS where they operate as the inaugural Artistic & Executive Director of the Highland Arts Theatre (or HAT). They studied theatre performance at Sheridan and George Brown College and spent eight years working in  Toronto‚Äôs¬†independent¬†theatre scene, working as a¬†writer, director, actor, and producer for multiple companies, as well as box office manager for Tarragon Theatre. Their plays have been produced in three provinces and have won national awards, been published, and adapted for film. Under their leadership, the Highland Arts Theatre has produced more than 100 mainstage theatrical productions in the past ten years and been nominated for Dora, Merritt, Excellence in Business, and Nova Scotia Music Industry Awards. They are a recipient of a 2015 Vital Award, the 2016 Jack Yazer Young Entrepreneur of the Year¬†Award, The Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Medal,¬†and have been nominated for ‚ÄúBusiness Person of the Year‚Äù from the Sydney and Area Chamber of Commerce Excellence in Business Awards. They were recently honoured as one of the Globe & Mail‚Äôs ‚ÄúCanadian Arts Heroes of 2020‚Äù for their work developing the HAT‚Äôs bold new funding model, Radical Access. adriana dimitri GENERAL MANAGER (she/her) Adriana is the General Manager of the HAT. She spends most of her time making sure the theatre is running smoothly and finding ways to improve our processes and systems. She has a Bachelor of Fine Arts, with honors in Production from York University and has worked in theatre across Canada and abroad at companies such as The Canadian Opera Company, Mirvish Productions, The Edinburgh Fringe Festival and the Centre for Opera studies in Italy. She is passionate about exploring alternate ways of working and different ways of leading, having worked for global companies in Defence and in the professional service industry. When she is not at the theatre, you can find her cuddling her two kitties, Burke and Arlo. KAYLA CORMIER TECHNICAL DIRECTOR (she/her) Kayla is the Technical Director and Resident Designer at the Highland Arts Theatre. She has designed and constructed the set, costume, and/or props for over 50 productions e.g. She Loves Me (Set), Mary‚Äôs Wedding (Set and Costume), West Moon (Set and Costume), and Little Shop of Horrors (Set). Kayla received a Vital Award (2020) for her work at the Highland Arts Theatre and was the recipient of a Robert Merritt Award (2023) for outstanding costume design for the HAT's production of The Happy Prince. Kiersten Penny PATRON SERVICES MANAGER (she/her) Tom Colford COMMUNICATIONS DIRECTOR (he/him) Tom has been informally involved with the Highland Arts Theatre since it began in 2014, as a frequent consultant. Over the years he has performed, directed, choreographed, written, filmed and produced at the HAT (not to mention painted hallways, moved pianos, been a bouncer and pulled all nighters setting lights with Ken).  At the end of 2019 Tom took over as social media manager at the HAT and in 2021 expanded that role to Communications Director for the organization. The HAT is near and dear to his heart, as the place he wished he had downtown when he was growing up in Cape Breton. HILARY SCOTT PROMOTIONS & GRAPHIC DESIGNER (she/her) Hilary is a co-founder of the Highland Arts Theatre, and served as Assistant Artistic Director from 2014 to 2017.  She continues of be a close collaborator at the HAT. A graduate of George Brown‚Äôs Theatre Conservatory Program, and a Certificate Holder in Art & Design Studio Skills from OCAD U. She has worn nearly every hat at the HAT, onstage and off; from season programming, patron services, and 4 AM set painting, to lighting, directing, and performing. Currently she operates out of Toronto as the HAT's Lead Graphic Designer. The posters you see pouring up the stairwells are nearly all her designs! You can find Hilary‚Äôs artwork for the HAT as well as other personal works/commissions on Instagram @hilhob ! KEN HEATON HEAD ELECTRICS (he/him) Ken Heaton (Lighting Designer, Theatre Electrician and Technician) has been actively involved in theatre for over 45 years.¬† Ken has designed the lighting for almost every show and event at the Cape Breton University's Boardmore Playhouse for more than 25 years, working and collaborating with a range of groups from student productions to professional touring groups. Ken is presently the Resident Theatre Lighting Designer and Head of Electrics for both the Savoy Theatre in Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, and at the Highland Arts Theatre in Sydney, Nova Scotia, responsible for much of the hands-on technical work (hanging instruments, programming the light board, etc.) that would be the work of the lighting crew in a larger theatre. Ken has created lighting for various productions at many other venues throughout the Maritimes, small and large, with many diverse theatre groups including Made With Purpose , the St Anne‚Äôs Bay Players , New York‚Äôs Yara Arts Group , Acadia Drama Group , Musicadians , Bells of Baddeck , and the Zuppa Theatre Co . Ken's lighting designs have toured with productions internationally, reaching at times as far as New Zealand. Recent lighting designs include pretty much everything¬†produced at the HAT since 2014, including the recent productions of 'Cabaret', and 'Samqwan' (for which Ken was nominated for a 'Robert Merritt Award' for Lighting Design). If you don't find Ken in a theatre, try looking on a sailboat somewhere out on the Bras d'Or Lakes.¬† He'll probably be there...
